actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Operations.

official_title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress that a "Freedom Park", in Washington, DC, be dedicated to the Americans who were held in Iran and the servicemen who died in the rescue attempt in Iran, to extend thanks to all the Canadians, Algerians, and Americans who played a role in the return of the Americans who were held in Iran, and to recommit the Congress to diplomatic tradition and peace among all nations.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that a "Freedom Park" in the District of Columbia, should be dedicated to the Americans who were held in Iran and to the servicemen who died in the rescue attempt in Iran. Extends Congressional thanks to the Canadians, Algerians, and Americans who played a role in the return of the Americans from Iran. Recommits Congress to diplomatic tradition and peace among all nations.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress that a "Freedom Park", in Washington, DC, be dedicated to the Americans who were held in Iran and the servicemen who died in the rescue attempt in Iran, to extend thanks to all the Canadians, Algerians, and Americans who played a role in the return of the Americans who were held in Iran, and to recommit the Congress to diplomatic tradition and peace among all nations.
